1: After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed the day he was born.\q
3:
"May the day on which I was born perish,\q the night that said, 'A boy has been conceived.'


\q
4:
May that day be dark;\q may not God from above call it to mind,
\q neither may the sun shine on it.
\q
7:
See, may that night be barren;\q may no joyful voice come into it.


\q
8:
May they curse that day,\q those who know how to wake up Leviathan.
\q
10:
because it did not shut up the doors of my mother's womb,\q and because it did not hide trouble from my eyes.


\q
11:
Why did I not die when I came out from the womb?\q Why did I not give up my spirit when my mother bore me?
\q
12:
Why did her knees welcome me?\q Why did her breasts receive me so that I should suck?


\q
13:
For now I would have been lying down quietly.\q I would have slept and been at rest
\q
14:
with kings and counselors of the earth,\q who built up tombs for themselves that are now in ruins.


\q
15:
Or I would have been lying with princes who once had gold,\q who had filled their houses with silver.
\q
16:
Or perhaps I would have been stillborn,\q like infants that never see the light.


\q
17:
There the wicked cease from trouble;\q there the weary are at rest.
\q
18:
There the prisoners are at ease together;\q they do not hear the voice of the slave driver.
\q
19:
Both small and great people are there;\q the servant is free from his master there.


\q
20:
Why is light given to him who is in misery?\q Why is life given to the one who is bitter in soul,
\q
21:
to one who longs for death without it coming;\q to one who digs for death more than for hidden treasure?
\q
22:
Why is light given to one who rejoices very much\q and is glad when he finds the grave?


\q
23:
Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden,\q a man whom God has hedged in?
\q
24:
For my sighing happens instead of eating;\q my groaning is poured out like water.


\q
25:
For the thing that I feared has come on me;\q what I was afraid of has come to me.
\q
26: I am not at ease, I am not quiet, and I have no rest;\q trouble comes instead."
